soil: Sandy loam soil with good drainage
how_to_start: Select a sunny location. Use raised beds. Sow seeds directly and irrigate regularly. Avoid overwatering.
Prepare fine-tilled land. Use hybrid seeds. Apply fertilizers and irrigate. Harvest when cob husks turn brown.
Sow seeds directly in rows. Thin seedlings. Apply nitrogen and potassium. Irrigate during flowering and seed formation.

soil: Well-drained loamy or clay loam soil
how_to_start: Plough the land, use certified seeds, apply basal fertilizers, and ensure proper irrigation. Harvest at maturity.
Sow in cool season. Irrigate twice. Use organic manure. Harvest when pods are dry and yellow.

soil: Well-drained loamy soil rich in organic matter
how_to_start: Sow seeds directly. Provide support for climbing varieties. Harvest young pods every few days.

soil: Clayey or silty loam soil that retains water
how_to_start: Prepare nursery, transplant into puddled field, irrigate regularly, and apply nitrogen-rich fertilizers.
Sow before monsoon. Use treated seeds. Weed regularly. Harvest when pods turn brown and dry.

soil: Black cotton soil or sandy loam
how_to_start: Use high-yield BT cotton seeds. Provide timely irrigation. Control pests. Harvest after boll opening.
Sow seeds directly in rows. Use minimal irrigation. Ideal for drought-prone areas. Harvest when grains harden.
Direct sowing on raised beds. Maintain moisture. Provide trellis support. Harvest young fruits regularly.

soil: Fertile loamy soil with good drainage
how_to_start: Plough the field deeply. Use quality seeds. Apply compost and fertilizers. Harvest when spikes turn golden.
